intro: Phagnalon scariosum, commonly known as the common phagnalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy, grayish-green foliage and is native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, often growing in sunny locations. Phagnalon scariosum is known for its hardy nature and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
